article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-YAKoU2 hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: Could You Outrun A Tyrannosaurus Rex?

div.p: Just how quick was the great tyrant lizard, exactly? Experts in biomechanics think she was pretty damn quick – but still probably not as fast as you think.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-13Y3jwo hentry entry story-col-1

header.div: NOT THE WORSE THING TO SEE ON THE WEB

h2.a: Here’s A Horrific Scientific Survey Of 50 Bats Being Captured By Spiders

div.p: Here’s some nightmare fuel you could have gone the rest of your life without knowing: every continent except Antarctica hosts spiders so large, they can trap bats in their webs.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-ZnS9PT hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: Catching Up With Kai, The Hatchet-Wielding Hitchhiker

div.p: Kai doesn't have a driver's license, a social security card, or a passport. I was told he was impossible to get in touch with, but through my incredible stalking abilities we became friends.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-13YTIW7 hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: Fake Twitter Followers Becomes Multimillion-Dollar Business

div.p: Far from slowing, the market for fake Twitter followers seems to be taking off.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-Y3oPrM hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: From The Woz To Some Intern, These Are The Mayors Of Silicon Valley

div.p: Foursquare is so much more than a discovery app or even a way to score discount drinks. It’s a constant battle against other users to become, and remain, the mayor of the coolest possible locations. Like, say, Apple.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-10DdKQT hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: Leak Detected At Nuclear Plant

div.p: The operator of Japan's crippled nuclear plant has said that it is moving tons of highly radioactive water from a temporary storage tank to another after detecting signs of leakage - a blow to the plant struggling with the tight storage space.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-12tbxb6 hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: My Code Made It To A Hollywood Movie

div.div: Lesson of the day: Comment your code well, so that you know that it's yours when it appear in a hollyood movie. hackoftheday.securitytube.net/... :-D

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-10HjlDr hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: 10 Of The Most Expensive Typos in History

div.p: Typos can be embarrassing. They can also be costly. And not just for those individuals whose jobs depend on knowing the difference between “it’s” and “its” or where a comma is most appropriate.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-14Mu0U5 hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: DIY Cardboard Rifle Can Fire Paper Pellets Up To 25 Yards

div.p: When spitwads just won't get the job done.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-10HkFGc hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: The 'Nuclear' Option For Total Facebook App Privacy

div.p: If you don't have any interest in Facebook apps (and, let's face it, many of them are suspect or just plain spammy), Facebook offers an option that works like a kill switch to keep Facebook apps and other websites from sharing or accessing your information.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-Z78Ysf hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: The Mind Behind Minecraft

div.p: Is Minecraft a once-in-a-lifetime success—a “Tainted Love,” a Tetris—or a foundational work for the next great video-game auteur, like the creator of Sim City and The Sims, Will Wright?

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-YXmLVj hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: Thai Crowd Breaks Hula-Hoop Record

div.p: The world record for most number of people simultaneously hula-hooping was recently broken at Thammasat University stadium, near Bangkok.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-ZEgV7p hentry entry story-col-0

header.div: THE END OF THE BRUTALISM AESTHETIC

h2.a: FBI Building May Soon Be 'Put Out Of Its Misery'

div.p: The Federal Bureau of Investigation headquarters in Washington, just blocks from the White House, has long been the government building everyone loves to hate.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-14JWNbH hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: 14 Breathtaking Pics From The U.S. Interior's Must-Follow Instagram

div.p: If you’re actually curious as to what goes on at Interior head on over to Instagram, where it has by far the best account on the app. Its 33,000 wise followers know what’s up.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-13ULY7r hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: New PAC Only Supports Bearded Political Candidates

div.p: A Political Action Committee (PAC) launched this week to support bearded candidates, according to paperwork filed Wednesday with the Federal Election Commission.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-Y4zvq2 hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: Can We Control Our Thoughts?

div.p: We are aware of a tiny fraction of the thinking that goes on in our minds, and we can control only a tiny part of our conscious thoughts. The vast majority of our thinking efforts goes on subconsciously.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-13XY0Np hentry entry story-col-1

header.div: DOES THE RUNNING MAN SO WELL

h2.a: You Won't Believe That There's A Robot In This Suit

div.p: Boston Dynamics—the folks behind the brick-tossing BigDog—has released some new footage of one its other incredibly unsettling robotic creations.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-16BcxKC hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: Awesome Acoustic Cover Of 'The Game Of Thrones' Opener

div.p: Something to pump you up for Sunday's episode.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-14VcvRT hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: Austin Is The Next Google Fiber City... Or Is It?

div.p: A post entitled ‘Google Fiber’s next stop: Austin, Texas’ was live on the Fiber site at 3am EDT today. However, now it’s gone.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-YXSkyh hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: Weird Twitter: The Oral History

div.p: Absurd, absurdist, and in its own elliptical way, one of the biggest influences on comedy today. Meet the unwitting pioneers behind the internet's dumbest revolution.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-11sYEPo hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: Ernest Hemingway's Badass 1955 Chrysler Is Getting A Restoration In Cuba

div.p: Now they just have to figure out how to get parts for an ancient car into Cuba.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-16BPHVd hentry entry story-col-0

header.div: JUST AS SEXIST AS YOU MIGHT EXPECT

h2.a: Finding Mr. Right: A 1950s Guide To Dating

div.p: Female viewers take note: Be careful not to allow your own wants and needs to take precedence; it’s about changing yourself, not the other person. Oh, and make sure to find a man who knows what he wants.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-14JLNeC hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: Single Dollars Transformed Into Amazing Paper Collages

div.p: Drawing on every detail of the paper currency, Mark Wagner slices up each dollar bill and rearranges them into unique and unexpected scenes.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-ZjELfE hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: Infographic: Alice In Wonderland

div.p: A project completed for the Information Design module at the University of Leeds, which explores traditional storytelling through the use of modern infographics, numbers and data.
